div.div: Empowering Today's Learners to Become Tomorrow's Leaders

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

nav.div: South Amboy Public Schools » Departments » Office of the Superintendent » Statements » Coronavirus Planning update 3/10/20

div.p: As you know, Governor Murphy has declared a state of emergency in New Jersey (NJ.com Article) over Coronavirus concerns. Locally, we have an Influenza & Pandemic Preparedness Plan, parts of which are now in full effect. The Short Session planned for students on Wednesday, March 11th, is necessary for staff to plan and prepare for the continued education of our students, if the need to close schools is warranted. As of today, the district does not anticipate closing or cancelling any events. However, we want to be prepared in case we are directed by the Department of Health to close schools or cancel events. Our Plan includes a great deal of information for staff and parents. Please take the time to review. In addition, I have included a direct link below to both the Plan and our Coronavirus resource webpage.

div.div:
